TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed HorizontalAlignment extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Indicates where an element should be displayed on the horizontal axis relative to the allocated layout slot of the parent element.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Stretch is the default layout behavior.
Element <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Height%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Width%2A> properties that are explicitly set take precedence over the Stretch property value.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.HorizontalAlignment Center = int32(1)

Docs.summary: An element aligned to the center of the layout slot for the parent element.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.HorizontalAlignment Left = int32(0)

Docs.summary: An element aligned to the left of the layout slot for the parent element.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.HorizontalAlignment Right = int32(2)

Docs.summary: An element aligned to the right of the layout slot for the parent element.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.HorizontalAlignment Stretch = int32(3)

Docs.summary: An element stretched to fill the entire layout slot of the parent element.
